question: A body of mass 10kg is kept on a horizontal surface. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the body and the surface is 0.5. A horizontal force of 60N is applied on the body. The resulting acceleration of the body is about
explanation: Friction force <katex>$f = \mu mg = 0.5 \times 10 \times 10 = 50$</katex> N. Net force <katex>$F_{net} = F_{app} - f = 60 - 50 = 10$</katex> N. Acceleration <katex>$a = F_{net}/m = 10/10 = 1$</katex> m/sÂ².
